name: lucidz
text: A comment left by lucidz was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by sirhan_duran, blastradius, vermy)

name: peterjoel
text: I like the idea of an arc around the idea of pricking Boy George with a pin to see if it produces a hit record.

name: pogo
text: Hell, skip the pin and hand me a hot branding iron!  He'll really sing then!!

name: jalhalla42
text: In music news today, Boy George's new single "Oh God, It Burns!" reached #1 on the charts.

name: professorhazard
text:
You really seem to want to hurt me!
You're really trying hard to make me cry!

name: norsef
text:
Come on come on come on come on come on quit burning me.
Its really sore. Its really sorrrrreeee.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: hot off the press, if you will...

name: straw
text: Pfft, only the British charts.

name: spectre
text: A bit ironic, given that Boy George's bad decisions are actually about getting high on heroin.

name: dovey
text: That's not ironic at all.

name: spinynorman
text:
Naw, it's not an arc. It's just some fellas who have come to a Decision.

To contribute, about ten years ago they made a program that analyzed all of Mozart's symphonies and much of his other written music and "fabricated" another symphony of his, the 42nd. They played it for two groups of people - those who knew it was made by a machine and those who thought it was straight up Mozart. Those who thought it was Mozart thought it sounded wonderful. Those who thought it was a machine thought it was pure shit.

There was probably a third group who thought they should be sitting around listening to Boy George instead of machine-made Mozart. That group was ignored. Until today.

name: professorhazard
text: This is a great anecdote, and I will begin telling it to everyone, regardless of its veracity.

name: spinynorman
text: I hope its true, otherwise my musical theory teacher at Interlochen was completely full of shit.

name: norrin
text:
Sometimes they are.

I had a Speech teacher that failed me because I wrote a speech on not supporting legalized discrimination of Middle Easterners in the U.S. after 9/11. He was fired the next year for lying on his resume.

I'm pretty certain he made stuff up all the time.

name: king_duncan
text: My middle school health teacher got busted for smoking crack with students.

name: farqussus
text: I'm-a tell you something about me, Principal Higginbotham, you might not know. I smoke rocks.

name: thorfinn
text: OK kids, now I could sit here and tell you all day how bad drugs are, but you don't want to listen to that.  I feel that experience is the best teacher in these matters, so I'm going to need a few volunteers.

name: lechatbotte
text: Why can't both be true?

name: vermy
text: It is indeed news you can use.

name: sncether
text:
That's interesting, but I think they failed to carry it out to its logical conclusion. We must perform this experiment with Kraftwerk.

I suspect that the proposal itself is enough of a logic tongue-twister to burn out the main CPUs of some of their biggest fans.

name: sncether
text: And just for the record, I like Kraftwerk. But you're crazy if you don't think you have to step around a bunch of Roombas at their concerts.

name: professorhazard
text: Must be a lot of film re-enactments going on, there.

name: spinynorman
text: I hear they pay people to go to the bathroom on them. Is that true?

name: sncether
text: Yes. The members of Kraftwerk hate the Roomba component of their fan base. They register their disapproval the only way they know how: one hand playing a minor key with one finger, the other hand directing a steady stream of urine out of the flap in their jumpsuits.

name: postblank
text: I wasn't aware one could play a minor key with one finger.  Is it perhaps a really long finger going across the A minor scale?

name: sncether
text: It sure is.

name: achilleselbow
text: Nah, they usually do it right on stage.

name: steerpike66
text:
Nonsense. Everyone knows that in East Germany, the bathroom goes on you.

I invoke the great God of Lame with my incantation.

name: spectre
text: AMEN, Brother!

name: ttagxamm
text: See also: The People's Choice--Music , The Most Wanted Song, and The Most Unwanted Song, as determined by Truly Scientific Survey Results.

name: jujubeesforjesus
text: It's Labor Day!  Labor Day!  Oh what a wonderful day!

name: jujubeesforjesus
text: (lyrics from the 20 minute long most-unwanted song)

name: mjfitzge
text:
i must hear The Most Unwanted Song! it sounds amazing!

i love this part: "An operatic soprano raps and sings atonal music, advertising jingles, political slogans, and "elevator" music, and a children's choir sings jingles and holiday songs."

meanwhile, The Most Wanted Song sounds like it was just ripped off of Rob Thomas's latest album.

oh people, with their silly silly preferences.

name: edwell
text:
You can listen to them both here .

I found the Most Unwanted much more listenable - the satirical lyrics and kitchen sink instrumentation in the soprano's verses recall The United States of America (the one-album band, not the country.)

The children's choir praising Jesus, Mary, and Wal-Mart in the same breath, now that recalls the country.

name: morypcaina
text: Both are absolutely fucking hilarious. Thank you.

name: stormagnet
text:
Six albums!
(...yeah, ok, I'll admit most haven't heard of the others but still...)

name: fineoakstructure
text:
I think you might be confusing the United States of America with The Presidents of the United States of America. They are two different bands, separated by much time and space.

Please feel free to use this resource:

All Music Guide

name: stormagnet
text: Holy crap, yes, yes I was. My brain pulled that filling-in-the-expected-word trick on me, even though it was four days too early for that sort of shenanigan. Thank you for setting me straight.

name: stormagnet
text: ...and, having listened to some, that comparison suddenly makes SO much more sense.

name: spectre
text: Dave Barry established years ago that the Most Unwanted Song (winning for General Badness and Worst Lyrics BOTH) was "MacArthur Park." I mostly concur. Few songs would be improved by a video of Father Guido Sarducci singing them in Italian (IN the actual MacArthur Park).

name: pyromancer
text: I am I cried

name: spectre
text: That sucks too. Barry was surprised it didn't make the final cut. It was his personal choice.

name: zehnder
text: Does anybody else think The Most Unwanted Song sounds a lot like Mr. Bungle?

name: solobuttons
text: Whoah, have a chubby for knowing Mr. Bungle and for making that comparison. You're kinda right!

name: cathaoir
text: I've talked one of my friends into playing The Most Unwanted Song on his radio show soon.

name: otter
text:
Yom Kippur! Yom Kippur! Self reflection and atonement!
Yom Kippur! Yom Kippur! DO ALL YOUR SHOPPING AT WAL-MART!

name: hbaranov
text: Today, they speak out, and the world, will listen, or it will burn?

name: boredom_man
text: Until today, I did not know how ignored I was!

name: falseprophet
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: the_prophet
text: The Sun's not yellow, it's chicken.

name: steerpike66
text: The dastard who lamed you has a mp3 player full of mecha-Mozart.

name: lawbot
text: YES

name: donward2
text: It's always nice to see Ray and Beef getting each other pumped up. It makes life seem a little better.

name: linning
text:
This is pretty much how things evolve between my friends and I. We'll discuss something for long enough that we just get FUCKING PUMPED and then have to do it immediately. Although it usually revolves around getting high, and then driving to get some Big Chief .

Less enthused about Boy George, but hey, who's to argue?

name: toiletstore
text: It would be hell of harsh for you to hurt me.

name: donward2
text: In the same emotional vein, it would be hell of rude to make me cry.

name: talix18
text: I'm sorry that I have but one chubby to give.

name: donward2
text: Weep not for the chubbies you can not give. Rather, rejoice in the pleasure brought by the chubbies you gave.

name: professorhazard
text: That's beautiful, man.

text: [IMGS OFF]

text:
Assetbar would be easy if its colours were like my dreams.

Man I am pretty sure Boy George uses some crazy instrument to apply that madness to his face

heh, reminds me of vulva

Hooray, Spaced!

"Vulva, I'm talking to Damien!"

name: divot
text: I can't believe some of the shit I used to do with you!

name: zaratustra
text: yesssssssssssssss

name: terebikun
text: Agh I can't believe my first thought seeing the picture was The Mighty Boosh.  I now have to step down as president of my local Cult-Hit British Comedy Series club.

name: comrade_tom
text:
First rule of Cult-Hit British Comedy Series club: you do not talk about Cult-Hit British Comedy Series club.

Second rule of Cult-Hit British Comedy Series club: you do not talk about Cult-Hit British Comedy Series club.

Third rule of Cult-Hit British Comedy Series club: thursdays is Black Books night, Friday is 80's night, and the first person to proclaim themselves "only gay in the village" gets a stern written reprimand.

name: awko
text:
This is getting scary.

Last night (being Thursday night), I purchased the complete series of Black Books . Upon reaching the counter, the DVD shop girl was all like "OMG! I like, totally love T.V. from England! Don't you just love Little Britain ?"

I wept.

name: spinynorman
text: Look at this wine. I mean, look at it. Look at the colors. All the colors. Well, yellow.

name: synnah
text:
"It's like looking into the eye.. of a duck."

It is entirely criminal to compare Little Britain to Black Books in any way, let alone a favourable one. It's not worthy.

name: pityparty
text:
Do you love me?

Are you playin' your love games with me,?

name: ibetso
text: I'm Old Greeeeegggggg

name: tekende
text: Fuzzy little man peach

name: spinynorman
text: That was a hilariously awesome episode.

name: divot
text: I have to confess to watching it whenever I blow a job interview or choke in a similar situation. If all else fails, at least I have a promising career as a performance artist!

name: ford
text: When i read this, my eyes stumbled through the words "blow," "Job" and "choke."  It became a very interesting sentence indeed.

name: norrin
text: I read your comment before his and that's still what my eyes picked out first.

RABBIT RABBIT RABBIT RABBIT RABBIT RABBIT RABBIT

yeeeessss!

I have to confess to thinking (and quite often saying) "I knew I should've bought Huge Fat Cocks !" whenever I fail at anything.

In fact, the above was my livejournal icon for the longest time, and I was always slightly worried that somebody wouldn't get it. but everybody who is nice and good gets it.

Boy George's voice is tender like good steak.
It pleases the ears, and could likely halt terrorism.

text: i mean, just listen to this shit . the pipes of a goddamn angel.

text: [insert]of k[/insert]

name: mc_white
text: I knew I was missing something. Fuck silent k's

name: professorhazard
text: This strip makes me want to watch The Wedding Singer , and that's all right. That's all right.

name: donward2
text: Does it speak something of my character that I found the transexual Arquette attractive? Is this a Bad Thing?

name: professorhazard
text:
Your comment has spurred me to learn about this Arquette, who I heretofore did not know existed.

The aforementioned Arquette may in fact have a penis, so it is up to you to decide whether or not that is a Bad Thing.

name: donward2
text:
professorhazard, I quake at the responsibility you have laid at my feet. If I cannot find the answers to my most troubling queries in the Achewood forum, then what hope is there for me in this world? What hope, indeed?

On the original note; the back-up singer that sings Boy George in the 'Wedding Singer' is the Arquette of which I speak. She was born a man, but became a woman... at least that is what I was led to believe by watching the Surreal Life. I could be mistaken, though. I also believed the Urban Legend that Jamie Lee Curtis was born a hermaphrodite; I recently read that she was, in fact, a woman from day one.

name: tekende
text: Jamie Lee Curtis is neither man nor woman nor both. Jamie Lee Curtis is not a human being.

name: killerlimpet
text: fuck gender.

name: donward2
text: Based soley on your avatar, I believe that you are educated and knowledgable. Therefore you only speak Truth. I will now take you at your word no matter the subject.

name: tekende
text: This is the correct thing to think/do.

name: davey-boy
text: I think he was talking to the cat.

name: donward2
text: No, the cat just types faster than I. I was most assuredly speaking to the Christian Bale ala American Psycho avatar.

name: davey-boy
text: I knew that, I thought it a laugh to think that Ray, with his penchant for the lolcats, would conclude that a dude might have something to say due to the fact that he is a kitten uttering internet colloquialisms. This is what I think.

name: donward2
text:
I shouldn't have been a Cock to a Stranger.

Allow me to wage Peace on you.

PEACE!

name: davey-boy
text: I will respond in kind. I am not confident enough with my skills in BBS code, but imagine there is an olive branch or something appropriate preceding this.

name: donward2
text: This is a Good Thing.

name: scraggg
text:
You know who's great?
Huey Lewis and the News.

name: lawbot
text: YES

name: tekende
text: I don't really like...singers.

name: professorhazard
text:
I had a feeling we were talking about whoever played George in the movie - in fact, my first thought was "That was David Arquette?" Then ol' Wikipedia started callin' my name, and I learned it up.

I am sorry that I can't make all your decisions for you, donward2, but seeing as your ambiguous gender of "Hip Server" leaves me unable to determine whether or not it would delight you to have a floppy she-male cock in your life, I just don't feel that I am in possession of enough data to shake or nod my head in that great loud dance club of telling you to Get Some.

name: donward2
text:
Ah, I saw 'hip server' as being a cool Acheworld way of saying "I'm a dude who loves the ladies, and would like to broadcast it to all the available honies who may find some joy in my 'not quite unique' avatar of a cartoon cat who is the main character of the comic of which forum I member of. Come and get it."

I can understand the confusion however.

The Meat and Potatoes of my question is this:
Is it not normal for a 92.7% hetero man to think that a transgendered woman (male to female) is attractive?

I still think that she is a good looking lady for her age (which I estimated to be early forties) and I think that I would probably hit it, but in my naivety it never occured to me if this would be frowned upon by the general population.

name: professorhazard
text:
Nowadays, it just doesn't matter, dude. The solid descriptors of sexual orientation are becoming a thing of the past.

~Do what you feel
But be safe all the while
Or when you're banging a trannie
You might get the AIDS~

name: nbgreene
text: A comment left by nbgreene was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by lawbot, mortshire, Miku224, zulko)

name: thegoodwillgirl
text: Am I taking my cunt pill to protect others from AIDS? I think I lost you on this one.

name: steerpike66
text: It's entirely in keeping with Todd's macho idiocy that he should think that the Pill protects you from STDs.

name: phthoggos
text: See I just thought it meant you had a Unix box running Apache attached to your belt.

name: saucy_jack
text: I can't even begin to think why that wouldn't be normal, especially if she's post-op.

name: norrin
text:
Your eyes don't know any better.

I saw this woman once wearing a very short leather skirt and leather jacket in a bowling alley once. I pointed her out to a friend mostly because she looked so out of place. On closer inpsection it was a dude.

Until he/she turned around, I probably would have hit it.

name: tekende
text:
And even after he/she turned around, you were still pretty 50/50 about it, yeah?

It's okay, you can admit it. This is a safe place.

name: dkohan
text: I wonder if Ray found a magazine that's been lying around since, like, 1991.

text: No. The magazine is a magazine from the future.

name: norrin
text:
That decision being not being high on cocaine.

All the time.

name: redmange
text: I have made some pretty superb decisions about being high on cocaine.

name: pogo
text: That's what you think.  Your parole office might beg to differ.

name: the_voice
text: "I have done cocaine." - R. Beef Kazenzakis, September 2, 2003

text: A comment left by biznart was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by milkpants, ghoti, scraggg)

text: I made hell of bad decisions forcing a tired reference.

name: the_voice
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: professorhazard
text: I disagree, but I was raised in a generation that was taught that Gambit was a pinnacle of dudeliness.

name: donward2
text:
Gambit will always be my homeboy... With his glaringly stereotypical canjun accent and his tendencies to use playing cards as his weapon of choice.

Damnit Gambit! Throw a hammer! Be a man! You can't take down a two story tall homicidal robot using a deck of Bicycle cards!

name: professorhazard
text: He can, and will!

name: heccibiggs
text:
Oh man I have had such a crush on Gambit for like the entirety of my life.

Mmmm. I would totally hit that Cajun black-and-red-eyed cartoon mutant.

name: mattfish
text: and he would hold you in his arms and fill you with kinetic energy until you explode

name: heccibiggs
text: This is high-quality fanfiction waiting to happen.

name: achilleselbow
text: This makes me wish I didn't have to leave for dinner RIGHT NOW. If Dr. Manflesh doesn't beat me to it, I promise that your wishes will be fulfilled upon my return.

name: heccibiggs
text: Oh no I'm starting to regret this.

name: falseprophet
text:
Indeed, chilles doth fail to realize how Fickle a Creature is Woman. Yea, though he has declared his intent to write a fanfiction as prescribed in the rites of Courtship, before his return a Ladye so Faire will have chosen from among her many suitors the male who is the most Alpha.

So anyway, how you doin'?

name: tekende
text: Either achilleselbow left to attend the longest dinner in all recorded history, or is a liar.

name: norrin
text: I just want to take this moment to say that Gambit needs to be in the Wolverine movie, and that he MUST be played by Jean Claude Van Damme. No one else will do.

name: professorhazard
text: I thought Sawyer from Lost would be the perfect Gambit.

name: heccibiggs
text:
Oh God yes.

I was totally pissed that Gambit wasn't in any of the X-Men films. I mean, what the hell! But I hadn't heard of this so called "Wolverine movie" before now. TO GOOGLE!

name: dovey
text: Peoples! Gambit IS in the Wolverine movie, and will be played by a fellow named Taylor Kitsch, who is in Friday Night Lights, apparently.

name: heccibiggs
text:
Hmm. Hmmmmmm.

He'll do.

name: wittyname
text:
I never got or understood why people liked Gambit. I mean, his defining characteristic, to me, is that he was continually turning out to be a douche to Rogue.

And now he's a villian, so what?

name: i_love_kate
text:
Duh. French accent.

"*Guttural throat noises*

Mon ami."

name: tekende

name: donward2
text: Yes, and I would like to see Gambit played well. We all know what the Van Damme guy did to the Street Fighter movie.

name: norrin
text: Everyone sucked in that, you can't pin that on him. When everyone sucks in unison you have to assume it's the director.

name: farqussus
text: When everyone sucks in unison, all it means is every one of them sucked. At the same time.

name: thorfinn
text: When everyone sucks in unison, you have mastered the isosceles lock

name: miku224
text: Virtual chubby.

name: aliiis
text:
OOH one of my bestest friends dressed up as him something like four hallowe'ens ago and I still have the nine of hearts in my bag from that night! I have/had/always will have a crush on/did actually hit the boy who was dressed as Gambit, so high-five and a chubby for fellow Gambit crushing, sista.
I was dressed as Harley Quinn at the time. It was a good party!

name: ford
text:
Gambit used cards because it's easy to carry around 52 of them. If he threw a hammer, what would he throw next? His shoes?

...and now you know!

name: lawbot
text:
Actually, it's pretty easy to carry around about 208 for a dude* wearing standard jeans.

* Words importing one gender shall be taken to import the other unless the context requires otherwise

name: ford
text:
Actually now that you mention it, I wonder how many decks Gambit was/is prone to haul around? Standard jeans can probably pack around three per front pocket, but he still needs to carry his wallet and keys. He also seems like a bit of a holster kind of guy, and i think he pulled them from his sleeves sometimes.

Also, when Gambit plays poker, does he ever accidentally charge up his entire hand by force of habit?

name: lawbot
text:
I was thinking one pack in each pocket (two at the side, two at the back), with one maybe kept in hand instead of in the pocket.

As to poker playing, I think the answer is no, because if he did, no-one would play poker with him.

name: professorhazard
text: They have twenty pouches on their outfits for a reason, folks.

name: nosearmy
text: I always imagined Gambit pulling his cards from the inside pockets of his trenchcoat, or his sleeves, as you mentioned.  Storing them in jeans seems awkward, and in the photos I found online just now, he usually wore space-age tight pants with armor all over them.  Must go page through my back issues.

name: straw
text: You'd better start with Age of Apocolypse because those books FREAKING ROCKED.

name: nosearmy
text: AofA is/was awesome, but in general I prefer Marc Silvestri's frenetic pencils to the smooth computer-drawn colors of the late 90's Marvel comics.  The cartoon series ushered in a new era of comics readers, but I am not one of those people.

name: donward2
text:
Yes, but if I'm not mistaken, his charge was only a knietic energy charge. Therefore if he were to use objects with more mass, i.e. a hammer, then he would need fewer projectiles to do more damamge.

So, by carrying the 209 hammers that a pair of standard jeans are capable of carrying, then Gambit would be able to turn any Middle Eastern country into a democracy.

Plus, I could never get my cards to fly straight and on target, so playing as Gambit in the backyard always led to me getting my ass kicked by my friend who would always play as Wolverine.

(I took him down with that hammer before my dad started locking his toolbox)

name: sncether
text: It has often occurred to me that Gambit could have been completely unstoppable if he'd just spent 15 minutes in a Modell's in 1992. Cards may have panache, but imagine if he was rolling with a bandolier of Aerobies, and maybe a Foxtail strung to his belt for mortar-type purposes? Of course there's always the chance he might replace the trench coat with a closeout Shawn Kemp jersey, but it's equally possible he'd end up with some Bo Jackson apparel. Awesome.

name: tekende
text: "That really hurt! Who throws a shoe? Honestly!"

name: killerlimpet
text: YEAH WELL DID YOUR GENERATION WRITE MACGYVER FANFICTION?

name: professorhazard
text: Almost assuredly.

text:
Dudeliness and ugliness often walk hand in hand. Who can care that a man is ugly when a man is dudely?

Also, the jacket is extremely sharp.

name: professorhazard

text:
They blazed one little spliff and Roast Beef got scared
He said "shit man fuck what am I doing with my life shit FUUUCK"

The license plate implied that he'd been known to go queer

But he thought little of it cause he was lit up, dogg

name: hellofditties
text: Oh no oh no no no, I did not mean to lame you good sir!  I would take it all back in a second if I could.

name: professorhazard
text: I'll forgive you, but you should know that it's more than a little bit because you are a polite, eighteen-year-old female on the Internet.

name: hellofditties
text: That's what you think...

name: professorhazard
text:
Your sentences are songs sung in the key of lie. A bird will not land when you are speaking, for the branch will wilt under your wicked breath.

I wished to trust you with my fortune, but you have proven yourself of the crudest moral fiber. I think you would shoot a baby.

name: norrin
text: You should know by now that 95 percent of teenage girls on the internet are 45 year old men in divers helmets, revolver precariously pressed against the side of said helmet.

name: professorhazard
text: I have to keep some degree of optimism. I met my wife of eight years on the Internet!

name: peterjoel
text: 8 Years! That's quite young ... Although you probably aren't committing any crimes until you meet her...

name: mrprim
text:
Sir, I must applaud you.

I have read these archives backwards and forwards. I have read every comment, examined every tidbit. A short while ago I registered in order to reply to a comment with some sort of Shadownrun-themed witticism but halted myself when the pun I had intended to make became obviously less funny.

You sir, have recieved my first Chubby and my first Reply. Your ability to percieve alternate meanings in simple sentences is a shining beacon in the depths of the internet.

Bravo, peterjoel, bravo.

name: professorhazard
text: The most irritating part of the relationship is trying to get the blood stains off of my clown suit.

name: dovey
text: NOOOO

name: donward2
text:
this is the kind of person I was hoping to attract with my 'Hip Server' moniker!

Hey! Girl on the internet! Hey! Hey! Look at me! I'm a guy! I'm a 'hip server'! Get it? It's funny, right? Get it? Hey! Wait! Over here!


...Damn.

name: farqussus
text: i don't get it

name: hellofditties
text: Neither do I.  Therefore I think you failed in your attempt, donward2.  Sorry!

name: blindspot
text:
"Ray whistled for Todd, and when the squirrel came near
The license plate implied that he'd been known to go queer"

Question: Is Todd dead? I mean completely and utterly dead. He has not appeared since Teodor made his head explode if I'm not mistaken.

name: professorhazard
text: If you think about it, basically nobody has appeared recently except Ray and Beef. I miss Lie Bot.

name: hellofditties
text: He's still trying to figure out the secret hidden page in the menu.

name: dr_strangeglove
text: I'm not one to just mindlessly parrot the comic but, haha, "fuckin' A!"

name: heccibiggs
text:
I have to say, I sympathise. That was my immediate desire upon reading this as well.

The best we can do is go forward in our lives saying "Fuckin' A!" as much as humanly possible.

name: lawbot
text:
It pales after a while.

Also, straw poll: Are people more comfortable with my comments if they are in all-caps?

name: rowboat
text: NO

name: dovey
text: No. All-caps are so uncomfortable.

name: nosearmy
text: They give you BLISTERS

name: straw
text: And HALITOSIS.

name: catgrl131
text: And HEMMOROIDS

name: dovey
text: And SCABIES

name: catgrl131
text: And THE SNIFFLES

name: lawbot
text: Most uncomfortable you are ever being?

name: ford
text: Dunno man, I, along with everyone else tend to hate all-caps but you got kind of a shtick going on.

name: norrin
text:
I would accept it if you stuck to talking like a robot, kind of like the guy from Grandma's Boy.

Why didn't more people see that movie?

name: professorhazard
text: It is tragically underrated. I got a contact high from watching it.

name: professorhazard
text:
There is a time in The Big Lebowski where the Dude is blazing one and, strainedly, says "Fuckin' A".

A friend at the time argued me for months that what he was, in fact, saying was "You look like an egg".

name: tekende
text:
Were you watching it edited on TV? If so, it's entirely possible that that is what he was saying. They replaced the swears with some crazy shit.

"This is what happens when you find a stranger in the alps!"

name: donward2
text:
That makes me LOL in a way that hurts my sides.

The absurdity of that line synched with the mental rewind of Walter smashing a Corvette with a baseball bat is pure gold.

Beware of Strangers in the Alps.

name: professorhazard
text:
Entirely possible. Or, my friend at the time might have just been a stubborn dunce.

I had another friend who insisted that when Wario is selected in Mario Kart 64, exclaiming "I'm-a Wario, I'm-a gonna win", he was actually stating "I'm-a wop, I'm-a gonna win".

name: dovey
text:
I always used to think Mario saying "Let's-a-go!" in Mario Kart 64 he was saying "Mexico!"

Nintendo does weird things to a person's brain.

name: echidnaboy
text: "So long, gay Bowser!"

name: professorhazard
text: I don't think ANYBODY knows what Mario is supposed to be saying, there. "So longy, Bowsie" is what I've always heard.

name: i_love_kate
text: So long KING Bowser is the logical assumption.

name: norrin
text:
We still say "Mexico" in the way he said it, as that's what we heard as well.

I should point out I am Mexican and a lot of my friends are as well, so it gives us occassion to say it more than the average person might.

name: barrymorefm
text: Has anyone played Sonic Heroes? It's definitely OK if not, but it has a special place in my heart for some reason. Anyway, it's kind of a kids' game, but when punching things, Knuckles certainly says "Shit!" and Tails most certainly accompanies his boosted flights with "Gay!". Adds something.

name: tekende
text: In Batman: The Movie (the one with Adam West, not Michael Keaton) there is a point where Bruce Wayne, having been kidnapped by the villains, claims he's "clever enough to outwit you, you stupid thugs!" but it sounds completely like he says "you stupid fucks". It is hilarious.

name: spinynorman
text:
He also says, "This is what happens when you feed a stranger scrambled eggs!"

Weirdest shit.

name: professorhazard
text: Spouted by angriest Sobchak.

name: dovey
text: Youtube, Youtube on the Mac, show me edited Sobchak

name: albinosquid
text: I had always assumed that finding a stranger in the Alps would involve more spiritual awakening, less tire iron.

name: tekende
text: Maybe the stranger in the Alps mugged you and you were so mad you just took a tire iron to the first car you saw.

name: albinosquid
text:
That's a long walk, though; I mean, wouldn't the day-long trek down from the Alps be plenty of time to get over the mugging?

What kind of emotional ogre am I!?

name: tekende
text: Well, the mugging occurred after you took the stranger home from the Alps.

name: saucy_jack
text: I have been laughing for a good five minutes, sir. A chubby for you.

name: xiaomimi
text: Oh GOD I saw that version too! Fucking CLASSIC.

name: straw
text: O hey, there you are. In a couple days once new comments have chilled out, can you link up the blogs as is your wont?  It would be rad.

name: xiaomimi
text: Hey llama man.  We got a big deadline on Monday.  I will resume my assetbar magnum opus come April, no worries.  For now, not so much free time.

name: comrade_tom
text: "Fuckin' A" is the only English language phrase used in Michael Cimino's "The Deer Hunter"

name: falseprophet
text: And then turn our backs to the camera to show that it is our Mission.

name: tekende
text: They should find a way to listen to Boy George's tender and good voice singing to Chris Isaak's good guitar notes.

name: biznart
text: Especially that third one.  Maybe he'll play it again a little later.

name: professorhazard
text: His notes are so good, dude.

name: drago25
text: In the end, it may be true, but who among us wants to truly acknowledge it? Tender AND good, though? hmm

name: tekende
text: I don't know about "best singer," as that would be an extremely subjective judgment, but he is pretty good, really. Whether or not you like Culture Club as a band, you can't really say Boy George is a bad singer.

name: jorsh
text: quick someone deconstruct this so I can understand what they're doing in the last panel

name: professorhazard
text: They are walking together to the place that Ray keeps his Boy George music.

name: falseprophet
text: They have their backs to the camera to show that they are on a Mission.

name: hellofditties
text: The cats are walking away to listen to some Boy George.

name: wotown
text: The talking cats have decided to go listen to the tender and good voice of the former Culture Club singer.

name: professorhazard
text: Oh, dang, I didn't know we were doing it minimalist-alt-text-style.

name: thegoodwillgirl
text: I sort of preferred your description, but mostly just because it suggested that Ray has a special place for his Boy George music and that they are going there.

name: catgrl131
text: Well, yeah! .....Right?

name: rowboat
text: To your credit, jorsh, at first I thought they were just staring out the window, shuddering.

name: lizard
text: Are you talking about your avatar?

name: nickgranger
text: Roast Beef is sitting in what looks like the least comfortable chair ever.  It's like a skinny lazy boy in italics.

name: professorhazard
text: Based on the fact that an interior is only depicted in the last panel, he may be sitting poolside.

name: tekende
text: Nope. It's the same chair as depicted here.

name: professorhazard
text:
Listen, tekende. I don't wanna tell you your business or nothin', but Ray is the kind of cat who might relocate this chair anywhere that strikes his cat fancy.

Just something to think about.

name: tekende
text:
This is true. But even if it is the case, then it's irrelevant to the start of the discussion, which was about how comfortable the chair looked.

But yes, I suppose it could be the same chair, moved outside. Who knows, dude. Who knows.

name: professorhazard
text:
Not to be the guy who won't stop beating the dead horse, but I must interject that my point does remain - that chair may be a poolside lounge chair, such as one that always makes you feel like it will collapse under you if you put your full weight back on it - and at some times, it is inside the house.

This is all I am saying.

name: tekende
text: Ah, I hadn't thought of it that way.

name: falseprophet
text: This has been a Kindly Fuck Along Thursday, brought to you by tekende and professorhazard.

name: barrymorefm
text: Note that they could be in the pool house, Roast Beef's former (at this point, yes?) home.

name: epicurus
text: The last three little panels; we all have moments like this. Well, I do anyway. You should.

name: telescreen
text: The last time I had one of those moments was yesterday. My friend and I came to the Decision to go trap shooting and thus it was said, thus it was done.

name: professorhazard
text: Is that where you go out and hunt Alexis Arquette?

name: donward2
text: Nice. I like how you incorporate new knowledge. Consider this to be my chuppy to your post as I am out. Alas.

name: donward2
text:
*chubby*

Damn Me!!

name: professorhazard
text: Snuppy ?

name: woodenteeth
text: Rate this Comment: Cloned Dog Created by a Disreputable Korean Scientist

name: professorhazard
text: Did my mentioning Snuppy lead to a comic about Laika?

name: miku224
text: I'm also out of chubbies, but hopefully this comment will suffice.

name: grayestnova
text: I have had moments like this, and I concur with your statement.

name: donward2
text:
HEY! Girl on the interwebs! Look at me! See my sexually arched eyebrows? See my stylish shades? What about my Aztec pendant? Do you like it? Do you notice me? Hello?...

Would you like to see my MacGuyver fanfiction?

name: falseprophet
text:
It would work better if your avatar was Roast Beef instead of Ray and you just died over and over again and waited for her to make a few nice comments on your posts instead of having an A-type personality.

Then she would be all up on your MacGruber fanfiction.

Or whatever the fuck.

name: grayestnova
text:
This actually made me laugh for a long time.

I will only read your fanfiction if MacGuyver makes a dildo out of a paper bag, a Webster's dictionary book jacket, a bouncy ball and a strand of his own hair.

name: thorfinn
text: You didn't see that episode?

name: comrade_tom
text: I swear i saw an episode of MacGuyver that had Brian Blessed in it, how messed up is that?

name: dovey
text:
Man what. And I bet he was just all goin buck wild and yellin' shit too.

Hooboy, that Brian Blessed.

name: professorhazard
text: Lord, spare me.

name: heccibiggs
text:
Ahaha I can't believe no one has commented on the hilarity of Ray just reading that one article over and over and getting more and more irritated.

It reminds me of "Why do I even subscribe!" with the Polack-hating magazine. Oh, here it is.

name: lawbot
text: This is because it is not an incongruous thing for Ray to be doing.

name: aliiis
text:
YES that is totally the best part. He's just settin' himself up for failure.
I like to think he has been standing there doing that and making gradually more irritated comments since the last time we saw him. On Friday.

name: spinynorman
text:
As his thought flow chart indicates, a lot of Ray's mind works in loops. Very little if anything is every learned.

I'd say about 60% of Achewood arcs involve him thinking up a new completely ridiculous business plan, and then trying to follow through before becoming distracted. The boy just don't have much common sense.

name: thegoodwillgirl
text: I admit, I laughed at it when I read it, but I'm laughing longer and harder at my having been reminded of  its predecessor. Chubbies all around!

name: charhe
text:
Roast Beef has done some rude things on cocaine. Like making a business plan for a restaurant chain that would compete with Ramono's Macaroni Grill by featuring a waterfall in the main dining area.

This is because adding waterfalls to things is an essential part of making bad decisions about being high on cocaine.

Or perhaps waterfalls are cocaine's contribution to the world?

name: dino_grill
text: Cocaine is the unsung hero of many industries:  restaurant, music, film, publishing, financial, etc.  But apparently not the webcomics industry.

name: dovey
text: It however is the un-un-sung hero of the drug industry, or at least it was for a period in the mid-late 80s.

name: dino_grill
text: when you think about it, this strip just continues the hyper-masculine tone of the past few strips, because only a "real" man can straight up enjoy some pop music.

name: mattfish
text: Hell yes, man.

name: lawbot
text: Keep telling yourself that.

name: dino_grill
text: I'm such a man that I listen to Britney Spears in the gym while lifting weights.  So I WILL keep telling myself that.

name: tekende
text: And yet your profile claims you are female. Which is it, dino_grill. Which is it.

name: dino_grill
text: My masculinity is strictly metaphorical.

name: spinynorman
text:
Isn't everybody's?

(Most folks is frightened 'cause it's true.)

name: lawbot
text:
I'm pretty sure that my rad chillies are not metaphorical, but literal.

SO, NO

name: dovey
text: LAWBOT HEY HOW ARE YOU DOING RIGHT NOW MAN

name: lawbot
text: JUST AWESOME MAN HOW YOU DOING RIGHT THIS SECOND

name: dovey
text:
IT'S 11:23PM ON A FRIDAY NIGHT AND I'M ON THE INTERNET

HOW D'YA THINK I FEEL BABY

name: tekende
text: ARE YOU THE THING THAT CRAPPED BY THE GAS STATION

name: donward2
text: YEAH! DID YOU LIKE THAT?

name: tekende
text: IT MADE A LOT OF SENSE TO ME

name: miku224
text:
I really don't understand. In 9 out of 10 cases, when someone decides to quote another strip verbatim, it gets lamed at least a couple or three times.

Tekende, people must like you. That, or there's a new strip up so no one is reading this anymore.

name: catgrl131
text: OH MY LORD DOVEY, I WAS LOOKING ACROSS THE COMMENTS AND I READ THAT ONE AT EXACTLY THAT TIME ON EXACTLY THAT DAY! HOW WACKY IS THAT?

name: dovey
text: PRETT WACKY CATGIRL

name: catgrl131
text: *ahem* catgIrl? CAT-FREAKING-G I RL!??!?!?!?!?!?!?

name: professorhazard
text: She's so mad that you spelled "pretty" wrong.

name: spinynorman
text:
Hey, have you guys heard of this shit, apple jack? It's like apple whisky. Alton Brown says it's good to make apple pies with, because of some sort of crazy science horseshit about flour and water and I don't know what the fuck, and though I bought it to cook with I think it's pretty good just to sit around drinking with.

Yeah, I'm drunk in an empty apartment with the stove on. It's a regular saturday afternoon

name: tekende
text: Virtual chubby. This is good.

name: autrepoupee
text: I wholeheartedly agree, pop music is popular for a reason. This statement is not going to be so POP-U-LAAAR on the internet on the main, but Blackout is really an awesome album.

name: loneal
text: Was that...was that a Wicked reference?

name: thegoodwillgirl
text: I totally got that vibe too! I thought of Glinda (or was it Galinda at the time?) the second I read the word.

name: autrepoupee
text: I hate to let everybody down but it's actually a Peter Gabriel reference. Games Without Frontiers, a real hoot of a song. Although, I'd feel less of a pasty pop anachronism if I was referencing Wicked.

name: tekende
text: Actually, I think that, as far as Acheworld is concerned, referencing Peter Gabriel is probably a lot better than referencing Wicked. It is for me, anyway.

name: dovey
text:
Peter Gabriel, yes

Games Without Frontiers, no.

What the hell, Pete?

name: thegoodwillgirl
text:
As far as Acheworld is concerned, referencing Peter Gabriel probably IS a lot better than referencing Wicked. As far as the rest of my life is concerned, however, it really isn't.

Oh how I dislike on the Peter Gabriel.

name: tekende
text: But he's in a Geico commercial. A pretty rad one.

name: thegoodwillgirl
text: I must've missed that one. And lord knows I'm a Geico commercial fan. (I wish that was sarcasm. It wasn't.)

name: tekende
text:
It was great, he used that guitar talky-box thing, you know? Where he talks in the microphone and uses the guitar to modify the vocals?

I bet it's on Youtube. I'm not going to look right now, though.

I too am a fan of Geico commercials.

name: mr_lostman28
text: That... that was Peter Frampton. I don't know why I felt the need to correct this. But I do.

name: tekende
text: Yeah, I realized my mistake later. Sorry, everybody!

name: redmasaki
text:
Boy George's face IS starting to melt a bit...

At least he wrote a song about an African American lady in the south during the 1800s. There arent too many of those.

name: marcadelic
text: I think that last panel is like the final scene in Blair Witch, where their plan went awry when Boy George made them to stand in the corner.

name: falseprophet
text: It is silly to like The Cure but it is a thing to like Boy George.

name: abj
text:
As an achewood fan who likes The Cure alot, I am amused by this.

I like to think that Chris Onstad exists in a state of duality, where he simultaneously likes (Teodor) and hates (the other achewood characters) The Cure.

name: evolume
text: Boy George: Lady looks like a dude.

name: tekende
text: Other...other way around, dude.

name: dougthehead
text: ARE YOU SURE? ....

name: catgrl131
text: NO

name: tortoisesandbox
text: Man, there hasn't been a for serious arc since Leon Sumbitches.  Or does Onstad just not label things?

name: falseprophet
text:
Goddam man I am still waitin to find out what happened with Molly and Lyle at the gas station bathroom!

Did they make it out in time?

name: scraggg
text: Chubbied for spelling your obscenities in the manner of Holden Caulfield.

name: lawbot
text: Chubby for reminding me of that arc!

name: dovey
text: Well Beef proposing to Molly is post-Leon Sumbitches so I'm gonna say that Onstad is just neglectful in making the little box in the bottom left say things.

name: tortoisesandbox
text: Agreed.  Brother needs to maintain, if you ask me.

name: edwell
text:
If you view the source code, you can see how many arcs each year has:

2001: 0
2002: 7
2003: 17
2004: 10
2005: 4
2006: 7
2007: 1
2008: 0

name: chivalress
text: A return to form.

name: hedonismbot
text: Kids, do not listen to Boy George.  He is a ridiculous man.

name: professorhazard
text: Ray would not only beg to differ, he would inform you that you have no Fuckin' idea what you're talkin' about.

name: boredom_man
text: A comment left by boredom_man was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Thorfinn, mrcool1122, Comrade_Tom)

name: morypcaina
text: Chubbied for the effort and because I recognize the "Watching T.V." lyrics, but Roger Waters is too randomly racist to be a convincing humanist....

name: boredom_man
text: No endorsement was intended.

name: tekende
text: Roger Waters is racist?

name: farqussus
text: racist against interesting people

name: flazisismuss
text: You are wrong.  He transcended ridiculousness.  He made ridiculousness itself ridiculous.

name: wittyname
text: Pushing boundaries. Setting new records. Getting the train to stop at Funtime.

name: jonny000
text: A comment left by jonny000 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Thorfinn, falseprophet, scraggg)

name: mrcool1122
text:
In the reporter's break room:
". . . And that's how I uncovered a scandal of corruption leading all the way to the prime minister. So, Dave, what's the next thing you're working on?"
"Oh, you know, I got some stuff like that. I'm focusing on this story of a company that hires prostitutes for its executives to beat up as a team-building exercise. I've also working on the Andre Agassi story."
"Oh! Andre Agassi! What's your angle?"
"He's pretty. Very pretty."
" Whoa. "

name: jadus
text: Speaking of contributions to the world, good comic today :)

name: ford
text: your avatar should be captioned "the dark side of the beedog"

name: dovey
text:
That comment made me do this

[IMGS OFF]

I'm sorry :(

name: snick
text: Comment left by snick ignored.

name: lawbot
text: INFORMER

name: ford
text: Nothing like that image entered my mind at all.  It seems to be an abomination.

name: tekende
text:
I once made a birthday card for my dad like that except the light was hitting a piece of birthday cake. He's a Pink Floyd fan and yet didn't understand what I was going for until I explained it.

"You know? D--Dark Side of the Moon ? Get it? Geez, Dad."

name: jadus
text: lol wow. and it fits! i'm the biggest pink floyd fan ever.

name: farqussus
text: yeah, that fits.

name: quartzblade
text: In this comic, Ray and Roast Beef make bad decisions about music from an article they read using groupthink. Later they will reflect on today's events with minds unclouded, but for know they will think they are enjoying themselves. Observe.

name: lawbot
text: Are you a Marxist?

name: comrade_tom
text:
Got back last night incredibly drunk, i remeber checking achewwod, but when i looked the next morning the strip was nothing like the one i remembered.

My mind seems to be creating intoxicant inspired achewood strips and this worries me.

It's not rad to have alcoholism.

name: wittyname
text: This should not worry, your minds makes the most perfect Achewoods for you. You're enjoying the strip twice as much as the regular commentor.

name: irondave
text: Isn't it possible that you lost track of time?  Some significant length of time?

name: neonfreon
text: i dont like this at all

name: dovey
text: Your iconoclasm continues to astound and impress us all.

name: tekende
text: In your own words, explain why this is so. You must cite any sources used to support your thesis.

name: rygarrett2
text: man, i hate people

name: cousinted
text: Fun activity: Add the last three panels onto any strip from any other webcomic ever, it will always turn out awesome.

name: mrblank91
text:
By Jove You're Right!
[IMGS OFF]

name: wittyname
text: mrblank181, please have my retarded man-baby .

name: drskradley
text:
Let's try this with something universally hated on Assetbar...

[IMGS OFF]

name: drskradley
text: A comment left by drskradley was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, wittyname, hellofditties)

name: dovey
text: I like Questionable Content :(

name: mrblank91
text:
That's weird, I was just reading that comic... And listening to ...And Justice For All!! Oh Gods of the Internets, why do you taunt me so?

On the topic of your comic, the idea was great, the execution, perhaps slightly questionable (ha! shoot me...). Dora still manages to look foxy with a beer belly and Misfits t-shirt...

name: synnah
text: I dunno, it gets a bit poorly-conveyed towards the end.

name: synnah
text: Ignore this, I'm obviously talking rubbish. It gets a bit awesome towards the end.

name: farqussus
text:
I mentioned this in an ancient comic, but seeing you wedged it in here..

QC stole Ray's cry.
[IMGS OFF]

name: dovey
text:
It's almost as though the author of the strip enjoys Achewood and is making a reference to it in his own internet comic.

It's almost as though other comics do it too...

name: farqussus
text: You make it sound like QC has a personality of its own. I read it in the same way I always find myself watching Days. I just want to find out what happens. The indie band references are strained and the humour is bland.

name: falseprophet
text: You solved the problem. What a great workshop. Thank you.

name: linning
text: Beef saying "Fuckin' A!" troubled me for two reasons. The first being that my achefriends will assume I am quoting him whenever I say it from now on (and I say it alot); and that seeing that amount of capitalisation and punctuation in such a small amount of Beef's dialogue makes it seem somehow... Less Beef. Perhaps in his excitement he has momentarily forgotten how cripplingly depressing most of his life has been. I'd like to think so.

name: snidedk
text: I wouldn't worry too much, Office Space got to "fuckin' a" way before Achewood

name: drskradley
text: As did Apocalypse Now.  The situation wasn't as cool for all involved, though.

name: dovey
text: Don't begrudge a man his momentary escape from Circumstances.

name: kingsleymc
text: This is it.  This is the heart of Achewood right here.  Two dudes not afraid to go listen to some Boy George.

name: dougthehead
text: I love how Ray was reading the column about Andre Agassi being handsome over and over again.

name: irondave
text:
When I read Beef's blog entry tonight and clicked the "Next Blog" link on Blogspot, I got a blog devoted to:
Quote:
Composing Topical Urdu Poetry of Scientific Nature & Current Scientific and Technoligical Events and International Days

I am not kidding. I bet you could look this up.

name: boscostacy
text: oh man why are you listening to boy george like it is just a basic day

name: harrisonbender
text: Andre Agassi has a nice smile.

name: chuvak
text: He looks like he should be in a senior citizen's pearl jam tribute band.

name: chuvak
text: apostraphes: so easy to misuse.

name: thorfinn
text: apostrophe : so easy to misspell

name: mikeleffel2
text:
TO THE BOY GEORGE POLES

oh eew

name: norrin
text: What happened to the first Mike Leffel? What did you do to him!?

name: norrin
text: Assetbar, you son of a bitch.

name: professorhazard
text: What is Mike Leffel the anagram of?

name: cmr
text: "elk MILF fee", why?

name: tipist
text:
Elf milk fee

Those bastards overcharge like a bitch.

name: dovey
text: I do not want this to be an arc.

name: xiaomimi
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: mrblank91
text: I tell you what xiaomimi, you got some serious stamina posting all those blogs links. Presuming you're not getting paid by Onstad it's a fine service you have provided to Assetbar, and all for little digital bundles of love called Chubbies . Or perhaps it's an effort to swing the Interweb Karma your way. Whatever the reason, I salute you.

name: whoper
text: I never really noticed before, but Beef in the penultimate two panels looks for all the world like Showbiz got a haircut and a shave.

name: nice-on-water
text: There's really only one bad decision about being high on cocaine, and that's being high on cocaine, I guess, in the context of this strip.
